instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00163: What is 820-00163? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.U5110: What is U5110? This chip is responsible for SMC_RESET_L in many Macbook models..

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00163</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> PPBUS 12.2v no green light
threads.message:
Board had some nasty corrotion around and under <CHIP>U5010</CHIP>, traces got repaired and new <CHIP>U5010</CHIP>, but ppbus is 12.2v

<CHIP>U5010</CHIP> 
Pin 1-3 3.1v
Pin 5 0v

When <CHIP>U5010</CHIP> is not present I do get a green light and 12.56v on ppbus

Thanks

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00163</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> PPBUS 12.2v no green light
threads.message:
"<CHIP>U5010</CHIP> "
Do you mean <CHIP>U5110</CHIP>?

If board starts without it, your problem is on its inputs, if still bad after changed it.
Change <CAPACITOR>C5101</CAPACITOR> too.
Post all voltages of <CHIP>U5110</CHIP>.
Disconnect keyboard and try again.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00163</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> PPBUS 12.2v no green light
threads.message:
Sorry yes <CHIP>U5110</CHIP>, the board doesn't start without it, but without it I do get 12.56v on ppbus and green light

New <CAPACITOR>C5101</CAPACITOR> and same thing

<CHIP>U5101</CHIP>
1 3.1v
2 0v
3 3.1v
4 0v
5 0v
6 0v
7 3.3v
8 0.2v

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00163</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> PPBUS 12.2v no green light
threads.message:
Solve the problem of pin 6 first.
Pin 4 is also bad too...

Disconnect ketboard and check again.
If still bad, post <CHIP>U4850</CHIP> voltages.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00163</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> PPBUS 12.2v no green light
threads.message:
Pin 6 solved, 3.1v now
Pin/Pad 1 of <CAPACITOR>C5120</CAPACITOR> was gone, ran jumper and walla!

Thanks!
